subject: Indianapolis 500 (Auto Race)
Automobile Racing
lead_paragraph: Panther Racing has hired the veteran Scott Sharp to drive in the Indianapolis 500. Sharp, the 2001 pole starter, last drove in the Indy Racing League’s IndyCar Series in 2007 with Rahal Letterman Racing. He currently drives in the American Le Mans sports car series, and his deal with Panther is for only the Indy 500, where his teammate will be Dan Wheldon, the 2005 winner. Sharp, 41, was one of the original I.R.L. drivers in 1996 and still holds the series record with 146 career starts. He also has won nine races, most recently in 2005 at Kentucky Speedway. His best finish in 13 starts at Indianapolis was sixth in 2007.
